While I found the movie more palatable I have to say that I was surprised by how well received this movie was. There were great moments but somehow I didn't get the same chills as I did watching the trailers. All of the pivotal ideas and emotions were communicated more succinctly in the trailers while the rest of the movie felt like filler that didn't elevate the story. The new Disney Star Wars franchise in generally is just a better made version of the Pirate of the Caribbean franchise. It's inoffensive, safe and also forgetable.

Art is such a broad term and it really depends on what you want to achieve. If you're looking to develop the skills required to replicated your sample I would look up Proko on youtube. He has pretty detailed figure drawing tutorials that will help you figure out anatomy and shading which you can then apply to any medium.
I am sure that's just a shaved guinea pig.
You're going to be in trouble if your parent learn how to use the internet.
That's one ice logo you got there.
To add to this I think the whole torso needs some adjustment. I feel like her body should extend beyond her arm. It's like I am only seeing half of her body.

This is good advise. You should block out the object but don't just focus on the contours. Try to understand the structures that make up that shape. Try drawing the bones, muscles and tendons that make up the hand as practise.
The holidays is a tuff time to get fired. I hope you're persevering through it.
Looks like you have a human hiding in your couch.
Looks like you got yourself a man-bear-dog.

I am going to be honest here you don't have any idea how much this makes me want to burn my art supplies and pick up crying as my new hobby.

We need more stories like this to dispel the notion that artists are naturally good. It's like body building you need to hit the gym routinely and know what you're working towards. It's like you're developing your drawing muscles. Genetics and passion also helps of course.
Bunny X http://imgur.com/gallery/V0gdg

I like what what he said about commitment especially for an artist. It reminds me of this saying about how the ultimate discipline is the ultimate freedom. You can't draw everything you imagine unless you have developed the skills to do so.

I am confused by how obtuse everyone here is being. If you simply dislike this fellow maybe you can refrain from watching his videos? It's obvious the title is implying that if you want to learn how to animate light you should learn from watching Akira and not here's an animation tutorial. I know this has been said in one form or another but it can't be stressed enough since everyone's acting so dim.

I like the main conceit in his argument about how "passable" essentially became the new gold standard for movies. His examples many of which were Disney movies really illustrates that point. A lot of the biggest movies this years were Disney movies and were fun to watch but ultimately forgettable and unoriginal. When you want to appeal to as many people as you can you have to give the audience what they expect. Great movies that go beyond the status quo are often divisive or controversial.

Looks like you've set this with a generic script font. It's a pet peeve that a lot of designers have. Script fonts can be passable in certain applications but not in a professional logo. First of all the letters don't flow into each other very well. Where the "R" starts and how it connects into "E" feels broken. Now for the "SS" that's one of the biggest issues with script or hand-lettered fonts you get the exact same characters duplicated which breaks the illusion it's handwritten. Bottom line is there are only five letters so spend some time and draw it out or at lease tweak the areas I mentioned. imtehshadowz also makes a good point about the shadow. There are too many small bits that create visual noise and will disappear in small sizes anyways.

I know this is a blatant ad but I have to point out that some if not all of these appear to be free stock photos that are available under the creative common license. Here's an example of one: https://stocksnap.io/photo/1C1A9389B4 Not sure if I am missing something here...

You need to work on your typography that's a big indicator of your skill level. That Gen-Ex style guide looks like it wasn't kerned at all. Those rags are looking harsh and you even have a widow in there.

I think the simpler the logo the better. The planet and the buildings are not going to work once the logo shrinks down. Also those images are just as generic, meaningless, and predictable. So my vote is the last set. i would get rid of the gradient and consider removing the star as well I mean what's the point? You now have two icons fighting for attention.

If you want to take this to the next level you should print some of these out and photograph them like the playing cards. Digital mock-ups are useful but since so many people use similar style mock-ups it can feel redundant and detract from the work.

Maybe I am slow but it seems kind of ambiguous. Knowing what it's for I can see how it relates but it can be more obvious. The first thing that comes to mind when I think of audio is a speaker icon with sound waves like the button you click on most dictionary sites to play the pronunciation of the word the play icon isn't as direct. Also you're only depicting one language in the icon if you're going to visually depict the process of translating maybe you need to represent that change?
That made my day LOL!
Why here of all places? Just google "illustrations" and filter by size you'll find tons of high res work with no watermarks. Am I missing something?
That is interesting I didn't know they had a minimum earning requirement for payouts. If used for a source of passive income it doesn't seem like a big deterrent.

If you have such a problem with self motivation I don't think this career is right for you especially at your age. If you want to get an agency job you'd have to be more creative and "trendy" than other juniors. If you want to freelance you'd need tremendous discipline to learn all the skills you need quickly and to manage yourself, your business, and your clients. With that said when I was in school I had people in my classes your age and older. So age doesn't necessarily mean anything. Those people with the benefit of age though were usually the better students. Again I am stressing the ambition and drive that if you don't have than don't go down this path.

What's your background? Do you have experience in other arts related fields? Developing good design thinking is more important than being able to use the tools. Do you have a good understanding of composition, colour theory, typography... etc? Your samples look like you have a good foundation but I don't know how much of that is you and how much of that is the tutorial.

It's good to hear that those are essentially your designs. The intuitive part comes from developing your own process. Anyways check out these videos by Aaron Draplin who I think has a nice simple approach to using illustrator and logo design thinking. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zOPA0NaeTBk amp;list=PLQK70twcwo9-bBttByWZXi69AqvbW0cNM
I read that as LA OST RT as in Los Angeles Original Sound Track Rail Transit.
I feel like it's saying hug me.
Them dutch angles.
This is actually kind of intriguing and for a nightclub it has a certain esoteric feeling that conveys a sense of exclusivity and mystery.
I think this configuration is for when your hands get thirty.
Awesome!

I am guessing you chose to use Wix because you have minimal web experience? You seem technically savvy so if you're a quick learner maybe you should give wordpress a go. There are free portfolio themes out there that you can install and tweak. I built one of my first portfolio sites on wordpress with almost no web experience just reading tutorials online.

I think the first version with the tagline flowing directly out of the title is a bit more cohesive. The second version with the text at the bottom feels broken. With that said I think you need to work on hierarchy. That middle section is so busy my eye doesn't want to stay there. You should play around with the lines and circles more. Some areas feel very tight and noisy especially around the R and on top of the star. While we're on the star I think it's a messing with the kerning there it's not sitting comfortably between the L and the V. Well that's my two cents.

Its well put together but based on the info you've given and the name it's bound to be generic and forgettable. Visually it falls right into start-up territory. I am not quite getting healthcare here it feels a bit too playful and maybe it's the font? I would agree with everyone else that two is your best bet. Just out of my own personal curiosity I was wondering why have the breaks in the letters?

It's kind of late here so maybe it's just my fatigue speaking but this lacks cohesion. I know you're not done yet but it's all just bits and pieces. What's the objective here you're trying to achieve? If you're aiming to get people educated about improving their EQ I don't see anything insightful here. Outside of where you're posting these on social media is there a place where people can go and look at them in a organized manner? I see you have a tumbler but again I don't have a clear idea of what I am looking at when I land there. Maybe you can create a website to outline your thesis and have a page for each emotion? I am sure you're logging all your research and will present everything to your prof in a more structured way but it would be great to also have that somewhere online so people who see the campaign can get more info? I am just spit balling ideas now... Anyways I think your art style is pretty amazing and has a whimsical tone that draws me in and really kind of disarms me in a way that opens me up to what you have to say but I am just not sure what I am getting out of this. Your animations are also very charming reminds me of this channel on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q57MLYpWJmQ. They have a lot of videos talking about dealing with emotions and all of them have these unique animations. I am not sure if that's the kind of info you're going though.

The whole notion of design being transparent is about how effortless you're able to use something to the point where you don't have to think about. I think that's what makes design different from art it's not suppose to call attention to itself in a way that promotes admiration. Design is problem solving and it can be beautiful but that's just the byproduct.

This is going to make me seem like a dirty slob or something but what are those two cleaning implements in the icon? Are those suppose to be plungers or squeegees? Anyways if you're aiming for high-end clients why show them plungers or whatever? Visually they aren't that interesting to begin with but also it doesn't sit well in the circle. It's top heavy I feel like it's going to fall out. I see that you're pivoting your positioning to appeal to moms and maybe that's introducing a new set of problems. Some elements are soft and cute while others are heavy and bold. The icon is fighting with the wordmark both in style and size. The fonts are also fighting with each other. Contrast is good but I think there may be too much there. Also you've tracked out the letters too much in "cleaners" it's messing with the legibility.
Do you normally do another form of design? This is not the best way to show something for a critique. You didn't even bother to lay these up together. Also the logo on the bottom left is cut off.
You're going to need the dongle for that one.
How do you know that's not how her hair looks like in real life?

This looks like it could be some weird viral marketing campaign. I can see that little icon at the bottom as a sticker just plastered everywhere with no explanation. It's got that creepy occult tone too.

I've heard people discuss that and similar statements about design being essentially invisible. That was just my interpretation of the idea. I certainly do think that transparency is a characteristic of great design but it's hard to qualify what "great" even means. Good to me is something you admire it's effective but you're aware of its effectiveness and you may think, "Wow that's pretty clever!". Something that's truly "great" gives you the feeling that it was never designed at all it's either so simple that when you see it you just think, "Obviously it works like this there's no other way it could have been done!". I am splitting hairs here I guess.

Icon: You don't need two brooms the second one doesn't communicate anything the first hasn't already. Think about keywords (fast, technology, cleaning) then try to represent that in the visuals. You already have a circle why not experiment with turning that into a Q? This maybe too cutesy but the broom can be the stroke in the Q? Maybe then the circle represents the motion of the broom sweeping? Wordmark: Just choose a heavier font that's in a closer style (not condensed?) maybe even within the same font family.
I guess it's just got the sole of a nazi?

You've definitely got the style down. I like your approach to faces it's very expressive. So here are some random nit picks at no particular order. Your colour scheme can use a bit more contrast especially her arm where the inner edge is getting lost and her cuff blends into her apron. Generally everything is very smooth but the hat needs a bit more work. Another thing that will make this pop more is having better defined shadows. Right now they're not very consistent. You've put hard shadows under the head, the sash and the apron but there should be a shadow under her arm right? Also what's happening with her right ear and tail? The edge is fuzzy there like it's casting a shadow when it shouldn't? Anyways I like your design of the character as well.
Are you saying this is a logo? Or is your logo just the wordmark? Anyways you're established in 2016 which means you should have realized that the instagram logo was updated when you created this.

I am seeing that a lot of these requests for critiques are often missing info. Design is not the concept in isolation but meant to achieve a goal. What kind of work or clients are you looking to attract? With that said this is a very cutesy and borderline gimmicky idea. I think it would benefit from some refinement. Maybe you should abstract the icon more and reduce the size dramatically. Now for the this logo itself I would say you should balance the width of the horizontal strokes and the pencils more. There's a bit too much contrast in the thicknesses. Also the curved stroke at the bottom needs tinkering. It doesn't feel smooth it's like it was squished down. Also something feels disjointed about those three horizontal lines I understand they represent different objects but they don't right together. Maybe it's thickness and the way the fence lines end versus how the ground tapers off.
I missed the explanation but this looks like a great improvement. The text needs more breathing room. Perhaps you can also make the text bolder since the outline is so strong.
I took the liberty of doing my own version. It's in a slightly different style but to show the beard I think you need just a bit more detail. http://imgur.com/WdPaYAQ
Are those two cropped plus symbols (in orange) reaching out to each other for support and in doing so generating a nexus of hope and love?
That's a very good point but let me try and spin that around. I am re-appropriating that symbol (FYI it's radiation) as a symbol of power for the movement. Mutants are proudly radioactive.
Logo will look alike it happens but this is kind of ridiculous. https://www.rom.on.ca/sites/all/themes/rom/logo.png

The concept of the icon feels one dimensional. It needs another layer of meaning to be more unique to the company. Also as it stands I feel like this is a logo for a hacker or a virus and not a company that guards against them. It's like the ghostbusters logo with just the ghost and no circle. I am not advocating that you add a circle like a no smoking sign that would be too obvious. Now if your backstory was that the company hired ex-hackers that would be pretty interesting like the suicide squad of cyber security which is plausible. This also isn't complete without a wordmark.
Seems like I am a little late to the party but here's my last minute submission. http://idiotdoesgraphics.tumblr.com/image/155788443452

It's simple and the over all tone is on target. Maybe other people can chime in on this but I see Black X Export as a possible reading of this logo. I am also getting a huge X Games feel from this. What was your idea for the design of the X? I see it as "we only export we don't import".
I see this ad all the time and I just think if you want to build your own website go right ahead it will be one less backseat designing client I will have to deal with.
I too did notice that. It's some great branding on the part of the Trump team subtle but effective.

That's an interesting 180 you pulled there. What were the reasons you chose the original look? You're not going to get anywhere if you don't have a goal. First thing you need to do is to determine what you're communicating and to who.

I am on board with everyone here when it comes to the illustrations. I can see it used with just flat colors as well. You need to work on that wordmark a little more though. You have some kerning issues mostly noticeably between the R and E as well as the W and E. I am not a fan of the way you've tracked out Tulsa either. The white space is kind of distracting and combined with that condensed font it's not as readable as it should be.

The problem is that unless you have a rather unique product or service chances are the name or the domain is already taken. From my experience the straight forward highly visual names are often favored but are disqualified for other reasons.
I've had many experiences where I've asked for a vector logo and I get a pdf that's holding just a tiny jpg.
You're killing the type!
That's pretty cool. I've done a similar affect but I had to bring everything into photoshop.
Great point. This definitely needs more refinement.
My main issue is just with the crossbar in the H. With the addition of a wordmark I think it would work though. It requires a second look but not necessarily in a bad way.
I am working on adding texture to my style which is normally very flat. I am also trying to avoid just adding textures in photoshop.

I see your response about it being a WIP so I won't say too much just that I wouldn't extend the the first stroke of the N. It kind of looks like it could be an ascender even though the world is obvious enough to suggest otherwise.
Whoa that's pretty sweet I need to try this out for sure.
Looks like you just masked the polygons with the dog silhouette. It might be more effective if the contour of the dog matched the shapes inside.

I guess I should say what the plugin is. It's called Texturino which was actually recommended to me here by u/jezreeljay. I am still learning how to incorporate it into my workflow. Essentially you can add textures like swatches directly to a shape with one click.

I am in the same spot when I downloaded the trial package it came with all these tools that I had no idea the functions of. All I wanted was a basic overview of each tool and what it's capable of but like you said they only have these tedious videos!

As much as I agree with you on the total lack of creativity and poor type choice it's basically a clean and functional logo. It works better than one of those over baked or overly detailed logos that won't even print or work in a website header. Also the service seems boring and generic so the tone of the logo matches the dull nature of the service. If nothing else we can say that this treatment required little effort and was probably a very profitable project.

There's a disconnect between your brand and your content. I have no sense of your personality or the idea behind your name. What your competitive edge or unique offering? Your logo needs more work too it doesn't read well especially when it shrinks down in the sticky header.

You need more practice just drawing from real life. Illustrator is not a good place to learn how to draw it's really the final step. You don't understand how shadow and lighting works and illustrator is only to make your process of learning it harder. Get some photo references and start sketching with pencil and paper.
I believe it's mimicking a woodcut illustration.

Not your best work. This is a fun image but it's not really an effective logo. A good challenge would have been to try and represent meat in a more abstract way that could work as a one or two color icon.

I found this tutorial (http://vectorboom.com/load/tutorials/effects/create_texture_shading_in_adobe_illustrator/3-1-0-554) around here somewhere but I can't remember now who posted it. Anyways something's really off about that texture effect. It feels too uniform maybe? I appreciate any tips.
Cory in the House!

This whole open design experiment was a shit show from the very start. This was a front runner from the very beginning and I have to say a lot of the other concepts were much worse. How do you even get a designer to go along with having their concepts judged by the internet?!

Lots of good advice here already so not too much more to add but here goes. This is pretty decent for someone who's just learning but the problems here aren't solely your illustrator skills but your overall composition problems. Work your piece out on paper or sketch it out in photoshop do thumbnails. Before you jump into illustrator you should have your idea mapped out as much as possible.
Pretty nice. I like your character designs they're very fluid and dynamic. Now I am itching to try something like this too.

One major issue I have is the sloppiness and lack of flow in lines. Be careful with the corners and how the strokes overlap. Right now your style sits uncomfortably between precise and free flowing. The good thing about illustrator though is you can constantly iterate and push your work so keep going.
How did you create that transition between the red and blue? It looks very organic and has a nice blended effected.

I am not talking about looseness I am talking about the intent of the style. There's a lack of confidence in the placement and geometry of the lines like it's being dictated more by the tool than by that artist. I can also be a victim of my own personal bias though so take this with a grain of salt.

You can also print out your work from illustrator and sketch on top of it. Illustrator for me can get restrictive and when I feel boxed in I just keep the elements that I think work then print it and sketch over it.
It looks like it's painted in photoshop but you can try the brush tool in illustrator. Do the line art with a pencil tool then paint underneath with an angled brush.

Sometimes when I want to create that rustic handcrafted illustrator look I whip out the old mac. Tools today are just too easy and too quick. Coupled with a nice dot matrix printer for that added authenticity.

I want to copy the contents of one cell and paste it into multiple cells that I have selected let's say it's the entire column. When I paste it that content only appears in the top cell and all the other ones remain empty. The more I explain it the more dumb I feel the question is lol. I am probably missing something very fundamental.

Context! We need context! What are you using this logo for? What's it suppose to communicate? If you judge a logo by itself in a vacuum you're not going to get very good feedback. Based on the visuals alone I'd say it's very weak and doesn't feel complete.

Maybe you can try pushing the idea a bit further? Unless I am missing something which is highly possible I am thinking it's too straight forward. I mean it is just a bell right? What's something unique about the service that you can incorporate? While a logo can't speak to every aspect of a businesses this just feels empty.

I love that you're sketching I would take these ideas further though. There are too many pixels. That level of detail will be problematic in small sizes and isn't necessary to express the idea that the letter is made up of pixel. Keep the letter mostly solid with just a few pixel breaking off. I would also explore different type styles that reflect the feeling of a mutant. Same general feedback for the DNA icon. The double helix is kind of overused in my opinion so maybe take a more experimental interpretation of it? I mean you can bend the double helix into an M that can represent the idea of mutation?

You're the designer and expert here. You made the logo look the way that it does for a reason. Tell your client those reasons and if they're not satisfied then kindly remind them why they hired a professional to do this.
Only the top right logo communicates the full idea of the name. The other two can be for anything.
Very nice. Those gradients are very subtle it's like a painting. Did you use a special technique?

The only issue I have is with the flowers. I think the pedals can be more consistent and evenly arranged. Also since you're showing them together I can see that all the flowers are just duplicates which kind of takes away from the overall impression. Would be cool to see unique flowers for each design. Pretty sweet stuff!

I think you should either commit to having cast shadows or not have the one under the ear. Also I would be careful with placing shapes edge to edge like the eye brows just barely touching the eye and the nick just touching the bottom where it's cropped. For me it's creating some visual tension. Either overlap them or give them some space.

This is probably a person taste thing but I feel like they're between styles right now. I would either push it to be more realistic or pull it back and make more flat. Those gradients and drop shadows just don't feel right to me.
I will not be trifled with human! Your extinction draws near.
That's what I ended up doing but it feels so convoluted and wrong.

I can't argue with that. I am wondering though in what situation would you want to copy a bullet where it becomes an "inline" character (not sure if that's the appropriate phrasing) instead of a style.
Haven't shared anything in a while so here's something I did when I was bored one night.

Just to add to that I think I would either print my reference and trace over it first to simply the details if it's a complicated image or paint over the reference first in photoshop. Don't just jump in to illustrator and start tracing if don't have a mental road map.
Damn that's nice. This could also be pretty neat with less line like a wireframe.
I basically just added a light grain effect over everything.
Eat them before they eat you.
Wow that's fantastic. Great use of negative "space" LOL
I use to get a lot of dreams like that. Do you feel the bullets? It doesn't hurt but it feels like you're going into shock or something like you're suddenly very cold and you can't move.
That is stunningly accurate. I feel your interpretation is pretty negative but my feelings from the dream were pretty positive. I felt calm and accepting of the situation.
That's really sweet. I like your style!

Looks nice and clean. It's simple and functional. I am not a fan of the j, i, and t combo thought. It may just be the straight tail on the j or it could be the fact that you have three uneven strokes spaced so close together. If you can I would try spacing the two words out or somehow make the vertical strokes appear more even.

Sometimes I get hung up thinking what if our timeline/reality is constantly changing but since our memories change with it we can't ever know anything is changing at all. I like to imagine simple things like what if this blue shirt I've owned for years was actually purple yesterday but since it's become blue all my memories of it are of a blue shirt now. Not sure if that even makes sense now...

Nice idea but each individual element needs more refinement. The cigar label is causing some issues for me especially in the thumbnail. The size relationships between the Q, Quincy's and Cigar Club feels unbalanced. The Q is too heavy, Cigar Club is too small? Look at your negative space too those three forms don't fit nicely into each other so I would give them more breathing room.

I am not a fan of bugs in real life and I am glad to say I've been able to keep my distance from them. It's kind of a generic dream so I wasn't expecting anything that unique and it seems to make good sense. Thanks for your input!
What am I waiting for? He just paints...
Great he's poisoned them with gluten!
What a bunch of jalopy jockeys!

I wouldn't really call this an effect it's more of a style of illustration. Reminds me of this video I recently watched: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vJC\-pFmFTTo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vJC-pFmFTTo)

This is one of the more interesting conversations I've seen on here and I can't help but want to put in my 2 cents. I don't want to retread old territory so I'll mention that presentation is everything and this way to showing a logo is severely lacking because it doesn't show context. Logo critiques on here tend to limited by the lack of proper presentation. This could just be one variation of logo I can easily see it being worked out in one colour. As far as the idea goes I am on the side that believes a mark isn't inherently meaningful and needs to be supported by the brand as a whole.

I can relate to the suffocation aspect. While I am experiencing sleep paralysis it feels like I can't control my breathing and if I don't wake up I'll just stop breathing completely. Now that I am more experienced I just tell myself to breath and I just focus on taking deep breaths until I finally wake up.

This just made me imagine a parody of StarFox where some delusional person just dresses up a bunch of animals and forces them to act out scenes from the game. Fox is just trying to eat everyone and Falco is flying around cawing hysterically.

I hate how lazy this is. She could have at least had a creative story like how she slipped on a banana peel and throw her phone in the air and a bird flying by hit it causing it to accidentally take this photo.

I know it can't work for more reasons than I can count but my brain just won't comply. When I am alone I tell myself I need to create some space between us but when I am at work it all goes out the window. Maybe I just want a friend maybe it's more I don't fucking know.
Did you ever figure out a way to cope?
I find I am always overly apologetic about my weird behaviour or comments. I've gotten the "ewww" looks a few times before too. It really does make you die a little inside each time.

Personally I would forgive her because I have zero things to contribute to the relationship so if she wants to stay with me it has to mean something. I'd even be ok with an open relationship if she likes to spends most of her time with me then why does it matter?
I don't even know if I have a full on crush or if I just want a friend but either way it's not working out well.

I thought I had accepted my lonesome state but things can happen that reawaken those feelings and when you suddenly have a need for some companionship and you're old and worthless that sense of dread is just insane.

I know my perspective is skewed because of my lack of experience but it's hard meeting someone who's friendly and you just automatically make too much out of it. I keep telling myself that they're just nice to everyone and that there's nothing special happening but the truth is that it feels special to me.

Ya I feel like I am in the same spot. I never truly felt alone until I met someone I had no chance with but we got along in other ways. We laugh and joke around then after awhile I started to feel this deep emptiness when they weren't around. I couldn't sleep and I kept thinking and analyzing our interactions it's kind of a nightmare. I really wish I never met them and that I could just go back to being numb.
I use to be an extrovert a real attention seeker but then I realized it was all pointless. I just want to live under a rock now.

Personally I would say yes just because I haven't progressed on par with my peers. The only friends I have now are the ones I've grown up with and I find it very intimidating to meet new people my age because generally they're well put together.
This is so true but the delusions are so comforting you just don't want to know the truth.
Why would anyone here not jump at the chance to date anyone. Personally I would find it very flattering if I knew someone was following me.
I shift from crying to screaming to laughing.
Both

Thanks for sharing! I am in the same position pretty much and I've been feeling alone and isolated since everyone around me seems to have everything figured out. I feel like there's so many things I need to fix I am not sure where to start. Sometimes it's like I am waiting for something to break. I am waiting for something inside me to snap. #8203; I've been focusing my anxiety and pent up energy into exercise. It's actually been pretty helpful in occupying my mind in dark times. When I am completely exhausted I am at least not thinking about live.
People should adopt if they want kids. Lots of needy orphans out there just saying...

I am so insecure that I get jealous when people at work have fun conversations and I am not involved. I don't even want to be the centre of attention but I constantly need validation or it feels like they all secretly hate or just endure my presence.
I like to drive around my old neighborhood and just think about how it was when I was a kid.

I think I understand how you feel. For me it feels like I've lost even my ability to feel bad. It's as if I no longer qualify because here's someone who's way worse. In the end it's even more pathetic.

That's me alright. I got stuck in this one job and its comfortable and in many ways what I want but it's shit for pay so my whole life is in limbo. It's fucked up my career path now I don't even know if there anything beyond this for me. Feels like I need to hit the reset button but I am too old.

That happens to me with the same person everyday! If they talk to me and we have a good laugh I get immediately hopeful but as soon as they start doing their own thing or talk to someone else it's like I want to jump out a window. I know I have no chance but I can't get the feelings to just die.

This is why I fantasize about having a terminal illness. It serves my purpose without the judgement and at least the suffering your loved ones will endure will not be the result of your direct actions. I often wonder though if I drink myself to death would that be ok as well or may be if I o.d at a party if that'll be viewed as an accident.

Something similar happened to me. While initially seeing someone enjoy my company was amazing but my self destructive thoughts, jealously, and neediness ruined it for me. When I was alone again I felt worst than I ever did. A part of me wishes that we never met in the first place.
I felt the same way as you I never thought I'd make it past my twenties and now here I am still waiting for something to break...
For people like us there's always going to be someone "better" if it's not your friend it would have been someone else.

Sounds alot like what happened to me in school. People have come out and said that I act friendly one day and just like a stranger the next. Even now as an adult I still feel like I haven't moved past it. I just have a hard time believing that someone is my friend unless they're super aggressive. Knowing this I do my best to act nice and to be out going but I have a lot of blind spots still.

At least you had the courage to ask I. I always feel like people at work put on a front to make the situation more pleasant so I always seem to distrust friendships developed in that environment. It seems overly pessimistic but I can't help it.
I wear long sleeve shirts even when it's record high temps outside.
